title: Ordering Food Like a Local
objectives: Point and choose items with 이거/저거
context: Korean restaurants often use direct but polite phrases with 주세요.
Pointing with 이거 (this) and using numbers + 개 makes ordering simple even without reading the menu.
Takeout, dine-in, and payment each have short standard lines.

sentences.english: This one (1) and that one (2), please.
Bill, please. I'll pay by card.

explanation: Point + number + counter + 주세요 is the core ordering pattern: 이거 두 개 주세요 (Please give me two of these).
Native numbers 1-4 often shorten before counters: 하나→한, 둘→두, 셋→세, 넷→네: 불고기 두 개 주세요.
For dine-in vs takeout, staff may ask '드시고 가세요?' Reply: 네, 먹고 갈게요 (eat here) / 포장해 주세요 (to go).
카드로요? 현금으로요? means 'By card? By cash?' Reply with the method you prefer.
After paying, you'll often hear 수고하세요 (take care/thanks for your effort) as you leave.
